We have completed experiments with polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, tributyltin, and bis(2-ethylhexyl)phthalate. With the current experiment we are examining the effects of perfluorooctane sulfonic acid on juvenile chinook. The experiments examine growth and various physiological parameters related to metabolism and lipid dynamics. All experiments are conducted at environmentally relevant exposure concentrations that fish experience in urban estuaries. Excel spreadsheets - growth values, plasma parameters, lipid content</abstract>          <purpose>Laboratory data</purpose>          <supplinf>These data are available to the public Peer Reviewed Publication: Meador JP et al.  2006.  Altered growth and related physiological responses in juvenile chinook salmon (Oncorhynchus tshawytscha) from dietary exposure to polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs). Peer Reviewed Publication: Meador JP et al. 2011.  Tributyltin and the obesogen metabolic syndrome in a salmonid. Peer Reviewed Publication: Meador JP et al.  2008.  Using fluorescent aromatic compounds (FACs) in bile from juvenile salmonids to determine exposure to polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons.</supplinf>       </descript>       <timeperd>          <timeinfo>
